A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The audience score is rigged ( 1/2 star votes don't count) and the critics' score is ridiculously high\, but could Rotten Tomatoes change the "critics consensus" at last? The consensus is hardly accurate by any standards:
- "Star Wars: The Last Jedi honors the saga's rich legacy"
No\, no it doesn't. It dishonors everything in the saga we've seen this far and denigrates the characters and the lore.
- "while adding some surprising twists"
Surprising twists? More like unexpected letdowns and unconvincing turns. 
- "and delivering all the emotion-rich action" 
Mostly it's boring and the action is mediocre at best. Good-looking though\, but not very interesting or exciting action.
- "fans could hope for."
No. This is a straight out lie. Fans are shocked and enraged of this filth Rian Johnson has delivered. Beloved characters are disgraced and the whole state of the SW universe is a complete mess now. I've been a Star Wars fan since the early '80s\, and it's painful to see the most greatest scifi-universe to end like this. Change the consensus RT\, that's the least you can do.
